title: How to Make Scalloped Apples

steps.headline: Pare, core, and slice tart apples, preferably a baking apple.
Place a layer of the sliced apples in a baking dish, sprinkle with sugar, dot with butter, or pour on a little melted butter.
Put in another layer of apples and keep on until the dish is heaping full.
Press the apples down and put in as many as possible.
Cover the dish and cook the apples slowly for 1 to 11/4 hours in a 300 °F (149 °C).
Fifteen minutes before the apples are to be served, remove the cover and spread buttered bread crumbs over the top.
Return apples to oven to crisp and become golden brown.
Serve as a side dish for dinner or supper.

text: Pare, core, and slice tart apples, preferably a baking apple.  Place a layer of the sliced apples in a baking dish, sprinkle with sugar, dot with butter, or pour on a little melted butter.  Put in another layer of apples and keep on until the dish is heaping full.  Press the apples down and put in as many as possible.  Cover the dish and cook the apples slowly for 1 to 11/4 hours in a 300 °F (149 °C). (slow) oven. Fifteen minutes before the apples are to be served, remove the cover and spread buttered bread crumbs over the top.  Return apples to oven to crisp and become golden brown.  Serve as a side dish for dinner or supper.  Finished.
